tag_list: ios, ios-developer, mobile-developer, objective-c-developer, developer, physicist, physics, nuclear-physics, cocoa-touch, cocoa
overview:
Arthur is a former nuclear physicist turned mobile application developer.

Presently, he’s the lead iOS developer at Shelby.tv, a social video startup. Previously, he was a senior iOS developer at Fueled, a Manhattan-based design and development agency.

Arthur’s written software for Firefox, Porsche, Ducati, Jack Threads, Bulova, Fantasy Interactive, and many others. His most successful app, FacePAD, was shutdown by Facebook in 2011. He created a new iPhone app called Photojacker in 2012. It helps you download Facebook photos easier.

Arthur’s software has been published in Mashable, TechCrunch, PC World, Read Write Web, The Atlantic, New York Times, The Washington Post, Life Hacker, CNet, Switched and a few physical publications.

Arthur has also been asked to give quotes on mobile-related topics in TheNextWeb and Mashable.
